intro: Urera konaensis, commonly known as Kona hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are covered in fine hairs.
